column4:
RT @SelectGOP: Democrats continue to peddle a false narrative on President @realDonaldTrump's coronavirus response.
 
The tough, science-ba…

One of the scariest facts we’ve learned in @SelectGOP is that mammograms are down 87% due to COVID. 

That is hundreds of thousands of lives at risk due to lost access to medical services, which means the fight against breast cancer is as serious as ever. 
https://t.co/vCD7ZHCg6w

Thousands of scientists are confirming what I have been saying for months – the unintended consequences of the nationwide shutdowns are having devastating effects on our nation’s public health. https://t.co/NyPI28irvF
Today in @SelectGOP, @HHSGov Secretary Azar testified about the unintended medical consequences America has faced during the pandemic. https://t.co/EpTE9pOVFr

As the leader of the free world, @POTUS has operated as an essential worker during the pandemic and continued working hard to get America through it. 

He and the First Lady are in excellent care with the WH medical team & I wish @realDonaldTrump and @FLOTUS a speedy recovery.

What’s the difference in this version of House Democrats' COVID relief bill and the last partisan bill they floated? This one has $600 million less for law enforcement. 

That’s not compromise, that's defunding the police. https://t.co/tjFpjVr5hS

.@HouseGOP has a plan for getting this country back on its feet with our #CommitmentToAmerica. 

The 3 pillars: Restore, Rebuild, and Renew, put us on a path to heal this nation & return to the historic prosperity we were experiencing prior to the virus.https://t.co/pdhqet5R90

Small businesses across the country are still reeling from the pandemic. @HouseGOP has a plan to get the remaining PPP money to them, but Speaker Pelosi refuses to bring the bill to the floor. 

How much longer will American families have to wait? #FightForSmallBiz https://t.co/woIRvE9xwD

Great news for MO ag producers! @USDA is now providing additional direct assistance to farmers and ranchers whose operations have been affected by COVID-19. 

For more information and how to apply, please visit: https://t.co/wVLNdk199V

Yesterday I joined @AftertheBell discuss the prospects of another COVID-19 relief package following the @SelectGOP hearing with Treasury Secretary Mnuchin.

https://t.co/k0LTB5fLEC

Today in @SelectGOP, I discussed funding for education, testing for schools and retirement homes and getting our economy back on track.
https://t.co/Qt8rLQMwh4

While learning from home was an acceptable alternative as we began understanding the virus & preparing our response, MO’s numbers have improved, cases & fatalities have decreased over the last few months and it is time to finally return to school. https://t.co/jQNMegFVhK

I have been & will continue to be a supporter of #USPS in Congress.
 
But Democrats are crying wolf over a manufactured crisis to distract from the fact that they refused to work with Republicans and @realDonaldTrump on further COVID-19 relief for America.
https://t.co/zc3vn71QxO

I've become increasingly concerned about hospitals’ inflated COVID-19 fatality reporting during my time on @SelectGOP. 

Now more than ever, we need to be able to trust the numbers our medical officials are telling us. 
https://t.co/stxhQErkrl

There are plans to be flexible and to continue to address issues as they pop up. As we go through and have schools open up, I think we can manage COVID-19. We just have to learn how to do that. https://t.co/kmtIfZEowo

ICYMI: Yesterday I joined @tperkins on “Washington Watch” to discuss the issue of hospitals reporting unrelated fatalities as COVID-19 deaths to receive more funding.  

Highlights and full interview here: https://t.co/JYocKa9AHo

I'm calling on @CDCgov & @HHSGov to address COVID-19 death misreporting in hospitals.

The 20% additional reimbursement for COVID-related deaths may have created a perverse incentive to over-code COVID-19 deaths, even if it wasn't the ultimate cause.
https://t.co/mm8M4N2Hic

RT @FRCdc: .@RepBlaine talks about the many deaths wrongly attributed to #COVID19 for monetary reasons. LISTEN
https://t.co/NAf2CqLB7y

.@CDCgov Director and @HHSGov Assist. Secretary for Health have now both confirmed in @SelectGOP that hospitals in some states have been reporting unrelated fatalities as COVID-19 deaths to receive more funding. 

This irresponsible and unethical practice cannot continue. https://t.co/zqzPxcFKH2

COVID-19 has created a real-life case study of CECL’s procyclicality & has shown it wreaks havoc in a downturn. This harmful accounting standard is bad for institutions, investors, & everyday Americans.
 
It’s time we eliminate #CECL once and for all.
https://t.co/wCtNdcyf25
RT @SelectGOP: “We have to be honest that the public health interest of the students in this nation right now is to get a quality education…

Don’t forget to join me TONIGHT for a tele-town hall on the coronavirus. 

Please sign up by noon today to join our call list: https://t.co/63PovFC9s0

Please join me this THURSDAY at 4:50 pm for a tele-town hall to discuss the coronavirus and what Congress is doing to help Missourians. 

To sign up for our call list, please visit: https://t.co/sitK7fzeTG

.@realDonaldTrump took decisive action to protect our country by restricting travel from China to slow the spread of COVID-19. Today, House Dems voted to undermine POTUS' ability to secure our borders and keep us safe. 

These political games are putting American lives in danger.

It was an honor to serve alongside Congressman John Lewis – a true civil rights hero, champion for racial justice, & advocate for peaceful protesting whose legacy helped make a lasting impact on our country. My prayers are with his family at this extraordinary difficult time.
Today HHS Assistant Secretary for Health confirmed states are inflating COVID-19 fatality numbers to receive higher payments. https://t.co/W8g3iXsMbQ

The media is only telling you that the cases are increasing. 

What it doesn’t tell you is that both deaths and hospitalizations continue to go down. 

https://t.co/ac3AgS4Lqc
RT @SelectGOP: “The effects of the economic downturn caused by blanket shutdowns have been just as if not more damaging to human health and…

Studies have found that for every $17 million the U.S. loses in collective income, we lose an American life. That translates to 65,000 American lives lost each month due to the economic shutdown. It’s important we look at the whole health care picture. https://t.co/7a3P38B3wl

.@COVIDOversight Dems are feigning concern over the loan process they themselves helped design in the CARES Act. 

Their demand for the personal & financial info of millions of Americans is an attempt to shame small biz owners & attack the Administration. https://t.co/vpyxdXLP0k

As we reopen, we should remain conscious of the fact that the threat of the virus still exists & is frightening for some. 

But we can continue to take care of the at-risk population without threatening MO’s society as a whole & get back to normal life. 

https://t.co/4uKqO1eACH

History has proven that unemployment has a direct effect on public health and safety. 

It’s great to see that employment rose by 2.5 million jobs in May and the economy is starting to heal. 

https://t.co/CoWQJFUrn8

RT @GOPoversight: "Reopening the economy is essential for public health," @avik tells @RepBlaine. 

"The one countervailing thing is that,…

We are all too well aware of the toll the coronavirus crisis has taken on our country, but it has been more than just physically. The economic fallout from this pandemic has put the mental health of Americans across the nation at risk. https://t.co/fBJnIikRfS

RT @SelectGOP: Every life matters. Every job matters. 

The costs of keeping our country closed forever because of #coronavirus are simply…

For Missouri farmers, ranchers and ag producers whose operations have been impacted by COVID-19, @USDA will begin accepting applications for the Coronavirus Food Assistance program on May 26. 

More details and instructions can be found here: https://t.co/u2SfJf4EHq

RT @SelectGOP: Grocers, truckers, farmers, and front-line workers haven't missed a day of work since the #coronavirus crisis began.

It's t…

From the largest cities in America to the smallest town in Missouri, everyone has been affected by the economic fallout caused by the COVID-19 crisis. The modernization of the CRA is a perfect reminder of the need for banks to reinvest in their communities.https://t.co/YXKZpAMerp

Not only did China cause a global pandemic, they manipulated the WHO to help them cover it up. 

Yesterday, @SelectGOP & I sent a letter asking Democrats to help us hold China accountable for the COVID-19 outbreak & the WHO for not doing its job. https://t.co/ilHLphJPFR

Today, House Democrats voted to pass a self-titled "liberal wish list" disguised as a COVID-19 relief package & a rule change allowing them to no longer travel to Washington, DC to pass laws. America needs leadership from Congress right now – this isn’t it.https://t.co/82AwINExpV

Instead of acknowledging that a non-partisan health and economic crisis deserves a non-partisan Congressional response, this afternoon's Committee proceedings looked eerily similar to those the House majority forced the U.S. to endure for months in 2019. 
https://t.co/A8WDeK9fnz

MO farmers, ranchers & ag producers who would like to apply for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) can learn about the application process & necessary documentation in a webinar hosted by @USDA tomorrow, May 14 at noon CT. 

Register here: https://t.co/VNkiEgvEOf
RT @RoyBlunt: Glad to see @RepBlaine named to the #Coronavirus Oversight Committee. I know he’ll work diligently to ensure the committee ke…

The coronavirus pandemic has put Missouri through a trying few months and our faith remains as important as ever. 

Today on National Day of Prayer, we pray for the families who have been affected by the virus and for the healing of our country. https://t.co/Qf4N7TqG03

TUNE IN tonight at 8:00pm for a live virtual town hall with the entire Missouri Congressional delegation. I’m looking forward to answering questions about coronavirus and addressing its effects on the Third District. https://t.co/ynxXo7fzYj

Instead of holding China accountable for its role in this pandemic, Democrats are using Congress' time & resources for yet another witch hunt & attack on @realDonaldTrump. I look forward serving on the Coronavirus Oversight Committee to hold my Democratic colleagues accountable. https://t.co/5jsLvMVDHM
RT @JamesComer: Thanks @GOPLeader for appointing a strong #COVID19 Oversight Select Committee. @SteveScalise will do a tremendous job leadi…

Nurses have gone above and beyond the call of duty to get Missouri safely through the COVID-19 crisis and have risked their own health on the frontlines caring for others. On this #NationalNursesDay, we cannot thank you enough for everything you do. https://t.co/HpflI9gL4N

Don’t forget! I’ll be doing a tele-town hall TOMORROW at 5:00pm to give an update on coronavirus and take your questions. 

To be added to our call list, please sign up here by noon tomorrow: https://t.co/sitK7fQQig

While the last few months have been trying as we've stayed home to slow the spread of COVID-19 , MO is on the path to safely reopening. PPP is back up & running, testing has become more available, & we're getting closer & closer to a safe return to normal.https://t.co/x1uk8mAy7l

Please join me this TUESDAY, May 5th at 5:00pm for another tele-town hall on the coronavirus. Looking forward to hearing from the Third District and answering your questions. 

To sign up for our call list, please click here: https://t.co/sitK7fzeTG
RT @SecretaryCarson: Notifications of our first wave of #Coronavirus relief funds have gone out to Missouri. We are all in this #TogetherAp…

MO businesses like our favorite restaurants, barber shops & florists have been devastated by COVID-19's economic impact & need help weathering this storm. Congress has passed a bill to provide more funding to the PPP & our incredible medical community. https://t.co/GrSDXTMJTf

While the Paycheck Protection Program & Health Care Enhancement Act should've been passed over a week ago, the funding will save jobs and, more importantly, lives. I was proud to vote in support of medical professionals, 1st responders, & small businesses.
https://t.co/rlB7H55obJ

For Missourians who don’t file annual tax returns, it may be necessary to provide the IRS with more information in order to receive your COVID-19 Economic Impact Payment. More information here:

https://t.co/mQK1qIkK3P

Please join me TOMORROW at 4:10pm for a tele-town hall on the coronavirus where I’ll be providing an update and taking your questions. To be added to our call list, please sign up here by noon tomorrow: https://t.co/sitK7fQQig

Please join me this coming TUESDAY, April 14th at 4:10pm for a tele-town hall on the coronavirus. I’m looking forward to updating the Third District and taking your questions about the virus & the government’s response. Sign up to participate here: https://t.co/sitK7fQQig

Missouri doctors, nurses and health care workers are on the frontlines of the COVID-19 crisis risking their lives to help all of us. On this #WorldHealthDay, please take a moment to thank these heroes. https://t.co/WSo48STzSM

Many MO children rely on free/reduced meals at school. Classes have been cancelled due to COVID-19, but the majority of 3rd District schools are still providing meals for students who need them. More info on participating schools and operating hours here: 
https://t.co/wOp4ogYGtJ

It’s #CensusDay & a great time to use @MOCensus’s new online response option while many of us are at home. Join me in helping MO get accurate representation & federal funds to support MO hospitals, schools, roads, disaster relief & more. Get started here: https://t.co/6bOMK4zBlD

Due to the critical role ag producers play in our state's food supply chain, MO farmers have been deemed “essential” by @DHS & @GovParsonMO  while we deal with #COVID19. Important documents for farmers to continue working uninterrupted can be found here: https://t.co/BIvvujZ9Kv

On Friday, federal regulators announced a 2-year delay in capital requirements under #CECL. COVID-19 has created a real-life case study of #CECL's procyclicality & exacerbation of stress on financial institutions’ balance sheets that cannot be ignored.
https://t.co/HZ8BjWIuWQ

The spread of #COVID19 has created an unprecedented situation in MO & our state/local governments need additional help to get Missourians through a health crisis of this magnitude. Thankful @realDonaldTrump has approved a major disaster declaration for MO. https://t.co/Av8xQasB3P

The deadline for REAL ID enforcement has been extended nationwide by @DHS to October 1, 2021. This is a big help for Missourians who haven’t been able to get a new ID due to the spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/306SISQVcN

Today, the MO congressional delegation sent a letter supporting @GovParsonMO’s request for a federal emergency disaster declaration for Missouri to give our hospitals, schools, businesses, & families the resources they need to respond to #COVID19. 

https://t.co/QAWfyB3CaK

The Small Business Administration (SBA) will be hosting a webinar for small business owners affected by #COVID19 with SBA Administrator Jovita Carranza this Friday, March 27th at 1:00pm CT. Register here: https://t.co/4PSfj0Qmbz

Along with the @USTreasury moving tax day to July 15 this year due to the spread of #COVID19, @MissouriRevenue has extended the Missouri tax filing deadline to July 15 and expiring drivers licenses and vehicle registrations have been granted extensions. https://t.co/BuEkebX2j3

As MO responds to the spread of #COVID19, or coronavirus, resources are available to ensure your families & businesses stay as safe & prepared as possible. Please visit my coronavirus information page for the latest updates and support resources. https://t.co/u09ex9BQul

Missouri small business owners who have been impacted by the spread of #COVID19 are NOW eligible for disaster loan assistance through the Small Business Administration (SBA). Apply for a loan here: https://t.co/waT18BaAfq https://t.co/ckGXYEHiuw

Today, I led a letter to Congressional leadership requesting the inclusion of a CECL delay in the third coronavirus funding package. It’s clear CECL poses a significant threat to exacerbate the current economic instability. https://t.co/k0n6xGMnDt

ATTENTION #MO03 Small Business Owners! @realDonaldTrump will be hosting a conference call regarding #COVID19 with small business owners nationwide TODAY at 2:45pm CT. You'll receive call in information once you have registered with the following link: https://t.co/utV9ss7phX
All Missouri Schools have been closed due to #COVID19. @MOEducation will provide updates on reopening when available.  https://t.co/MdfmoPFjK4

If you are a small business owner in #MO03 and need information on how to connect with your local Small Business Association (SBA) partner for assistance while our state continues to deal with the spread of  #COVID19, please click here: https://t.co/awX6pvf7BY https://t.co/ckGXYEYTm4

If you or someone in your family is not feeling well and would like to have your symptoms addressed by a health care provider from home, @muhealth is offering free video visits to assess for coronavirus. https://t.co/D4Il01pClN

Small businesses are the heart & soul of MO. In the coming weeks, they could struggle to stay open as the U.S. responds to #COVID19. Yesterday, the MO congressional delegation sent a letter supporting  @GovParsonMO's request for small business assistance.
https://t.co/m9C8GgngAv

We learned this evening that an individual in Cole County has tested positive for coronavirus. 

https://t.co/T8A00mXP3q

While our state deals with #COVID19, @MOChamber is offering webinars, resources and daily updates to help prepare and secure Missouri businesses and employers. Please find more information here: https://t.co/7RZZ30vWDQ

@HealthyLivingMo continues to provide updated information on the #COVID19 response. For guidance, visit their website or call the hotline at 877-435-8411. 

https://t.co/p5dIf6mWk1
RT @WHNSC: Text message rumors of a national #quarantine are FAKE. There is no national lockdown. @CDCgov has and will continue to post the…

Please continue to follow @CDCgov guidelines for staying healthy, but don’t forget that TODAY is the 1st day Missourians can reply to the 2020 Census. This is a good opportunity to take advantage of @MoCensus's new online response option. More info here: https://t.co/sZXiXK6o6Y
If you or someone you know is looking for guidance on COVID-19 (coronavirus), @HealthyLivingMo now has a hotline where you can talk to medical professionals. https://t.co/D2sVgkkRFm

Please remember to be vigilant not only about your health, but people trying to take advantage of this situation. To report coronavirus-related phishing scams or price gauging, call @AGEricSchmitt's Consumer Protection Hotline at 1-800-392-8222. https://t.co/xBgJ7eXoOX

Earlier today, @realDonaldTrump signed the Congress-passed coronavirus funding bill into law. It'll increase diagnostic test availability, support treatment, & fund vaccine development. Guidelines for staying healthy can be found at https://t.co/lqVmGitkpW https://t.co/251FJIT23D
Had a great meeting with some Mid-Missouri elected officials to discuss our state’s health care and infrastructure this afternoon. Thanks for stopping by! https://t.co/7wchrQrAVj

@realDonaldTrump has invited a MO mom & her daughter to be guests at tonight’s #SOTU. Robin Schneider’s daughter Ellie was born at just 21 weeks & 6 days – one of the youngest to survive in the U.S. Now, this miracle baby is a healthy 2-year old girl. Welcome to the Capitol!

In 2019, @CBP seized appx. 2,460 lbs. of #fentanyl – enough to kill everyone in the U.S. nearly twice. We’re only 9 days from the DEA's scheduling expiration of this deadly substance. My bill, the Stopping Illicit Fentanyl Trafficking Act would help put a stop to this epidemic. https://t.co/9jAzJy3sDv

Far too often, my constituents face challenges when accessing quality health care in rural Missouri. I will continue to advocate for all Missourians’ access to health care regardless of zip code. #NationalRuralHealthDay

The Trump administration is putting people first - committing to combat the opioid crisis by providing states with additional resources they need to expand access to treatment, increase prevention, and advance understanding of the epidemic. https://t.co/jwkHykWN6F

I had the opportunity to visit the @SitemanCenter on the campus of Barnes-Jewish St. Peter’s Hospital this week. I was amazed by dedication and expertise of the staff and I thank them for having me! https://t.co/qrrYBgKwdr
It was a pleasure to meet with @MOPrimaryCare representatives this week to discuss healthcare priorities for Missourians. https://t.co/z5L7C3YkhA

Honored to receive the @FRCdc True Blue Award for my commitment to supporting #ProLife causes. I will always fight for the most vulnerable among us and for our Missouri values. https://t.co/28MCkfortZ

February is #AmericanHeartMonth ❤️

As your Congressman I will continue supporting heart disease research and funding to ensure Missourians continue to live long, happy and healthy lives. #NoMOHeartDisease #BlainesBulletin https://t.co/hXe0yxNY3W

500 MILLION customers may have had information exposed, including passport numbers and payment information in some cases. We must make data security a priority and finally address this critical issue affecting Americans across the nation. https://t.co/ZprkmW4Rl3

Today is #NationalRuralHealthDay 

For additional information and resources, please visit the Missouri Office of Rural Health’s website https://t.co/m4oFoLh6Is https://t.co/uozUq6qLuX

Today I voted to:
✔️ Provide our troops with the largest pay raise in 9 yrs
✔️ Fully fund the Department of Defense
✔️ Deliver resources to fight the opioid epidemic
✔️ Provide Hurricane Florence relief https://t.co/b6yrt3VHHE

The VA MISSION Act just passed! 

This bill streamlines VA programs and prioritizes veterans’ access to healthcare in underserved areas. It will put the VA on track to finally provide the exemplary support and care our veterans deserve. https://t.co/TtfpgHDcnv

The #taxcutsandjobsact repeals Obamacare’s unpopular and ineffective individual mandate. You will no longer be forced to buy health insurance you don’t want, don’t need, or can’t afford. You have the FREEDOM to buy the health care plan that’s right for you.

My thoughts & prayers go out to all of the victims of the senseless tragedy in Florida. I look forward to working with the President to find ways to improve our nations school security and mental health care.

It is extremely disheartening that politics have been put ahead of our troops, health care for 9 million children and a functioning government.  Now that Senate Democrats have placated the extreme left, I sincerely hope they’ll refocus their efforts on actually governing.
Last night I voted to keep the government open and provide long term funding for children's healthcare. Let's put politics aside and get this done.
RT @MorningsMaria: North Korea testing how the US will react with missile launch? w/ @RepBlainePress https://t.co/dPbeYRk7k5
Talking tax reform, health-care, and immigration with @KRCG13 this morning. #MO03 https://t.co/mJSEaePODF
Thank you @POTUS for bringing awareness to the opioid epidemic. Read what I am doing in #MO03 to combat this crisis: https://t.co/MIpzd5dIxT
Thank you to everyone who participated in the human trafficking roundtable in Franklin County. Let's work together to end this epidemic. https://t.co/V4eIksGUsx

My statement on the American Health Care Act: https://t.co/nVi3vkS4om
I just voted to ensure that no members of Congress & staff are exempt from the American Health Care Act.
.@HouseGOP has introduced the American Health Care Act. Take a look at the bill here: https://t.co/g8nMTTwY3z #readthebill
